intro: Desmos robinsonii, commonly known as the Robinson's desmos, is a rare and unique plant species native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, characterized by its distinctive, woolly foliage and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its native region. Its botanical features include simple, alternate leaves and a short, erect stem that supports its delicate inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
